title: Secretar. Founded on the story of the Casket Letters
author: Beatty, W.
snippet: Howbeit, our beasts being some-deal spent already, and there being no sic thing in the whole place as a fresh mount, we had to content ourselves with a pace that lagged behind our desire. But, certes, it was well for us that it was so : we were indeed gotten past Blantyre, some three miles or thereabouts, to a place—a sown weel sheltered bit of road that ran for some distance by a hill called Dechmont, where was a fair and weel biggit mailin, when we encountered a horseman covered with dust, and something else, spurring at break-neck speed.
